ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Fighting on after linkdeath
ygData.msgSnippet: ... For a good fun thing to do in Highpass, charm a gnoll shaman on the gnoll side or a caster Pickclaw in HighKeep both will cast healing and buff spells on
ygData.messageBody:
>- I've never
>seen a charmed mob cast spells - but then again, come to think of it, I
>don't think I've ever seen a casting mob charmed.


For a good fun thing to do in Highpass, charm a gnoll shaman on the gnoll
side or a caster Pickclaw in HighKeep both will cast healing and buff spells
on you.

Pinen 30th bard(semi-retired)
Maxius 33rd Mage
--------------------------------------------
It is by caffeine alone I set my mind in motion.
It is by the Beans of Java that thoughts acquire speed,
the hands acquire shaking, the shaking becomes an e-mail.
It is by caffeine alone I set my mind in motion.
--------------------------------------------







-----Original Message-----
From: Elena Siegman [mailto:elena@...]
Sent: Thursday, December 07, 2000 8:59 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Fighting on after linkdeath

<snip>
Or maybe the behavior for charmed players is NPC while charmed - I've never
seen a charmed mob cast spells - but then again, come to think of it, I
don't think I've ever seen a casting mob charmed. Of course, I'm only 17th
level, I've never been charmed, and I believe there are many, many things I
have yet to see in EQ. :)

Lanianae, an almost 18 bard on Terris Thule
